pros: Small and friendly team of staff and volunteers.  Everyone is treated as an individual.  The Directors are supportive, flexible and positive with an open-door approach.  I have now worked here for almost 6 years, and I love it more than any job I've ever had (I'm 47!)  It's the longest I've ever worked anywhere!  I don't know what makes Charity Link so special; its quirky individuality perhaps :)  My wonderful colleagues are also a big part of it.  I love that fact that I am given trust and autonomy to lead on my own work, whilst working within a supportive environment that means I can access help, advice and practical assistance whenever I need it.  The Directors have been supportive in enabling my role to grow, change and develop with me.  And of course, I know that I am working for a good cause, helping to make lives easier for the most vulnerable individuals in our local communities in Leicester, Leicestershire, Rutland and Northamptonshire.
cons: The smallest kitchen IN THE WORLD! But it's amazing what we squeeze in :)  And I've also got a lot better at parking since I've had to learn to manoeuvre around our tiny courtyard car park!!

review_title: Working in fundraising and marketing at Charity Link
pros: Knowing you are part of a dedicated team at an amazing charity which is doing so much to improve the lives of the most vulnerable people in Leicester, Leicestershire, Rutland and Northamptonshire is very fulfilling.   Staff are all valued and there is a great atmosphere amongst colleagues who are keen to support and help each other which makes it a pleasure to work here.    The management is keen to ensure that individual team members develop within the organisation and are reaching their full potential.
cons: As a charity there are limited resources - which often means being creative and innovative!   As the voluntary sector landscape at present is ever changing, there is a need to be flexible and to think on your feet - but that makes for an exciting role!

pros:
- We provide a valuable and unique service to people in need, so I have found it to be a very rewarding job. 
- As we are a small organisation, colleagues are very supportive of one another. 
- I have had the flexibility to alter the days I work  to suit my childcare needs as they have changed over the years.
cons: In the 8 years that I have worked at Charity Link, there have been many changes in the sector which can be challenging

pros: There have been a huge number of changes over the last 30 years when I joined. I have had the pleasure of working with many dedicated and inspiring individuals during my time and it does really feel like a family. I look forward to many more years with the charity.
cons: The sector has been very tough over the years, but always rewarding.
